intro: Gonolobus pedicellatus, commonly known as the creeping bladdernut, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Sterculiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Its botanical features include fibrous roots, hairy stems, and a preference for moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in disturbed habitats and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
